answerText: Thomas Hardy[10] This Hardy poem, an examination of Darwinian evolution, imagines a "vengeful god" calling "from up the sky" and stating "Thou suffering thing, know that thy sorrow is my ecstasy!"
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 12 | 7 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: A dog states "Mistress, I dug upon your grave to bury a bone, in case I should be hungry near this spot when passing on my daily trot" in his "Ah, Are you Digging On My Grave?" For 10 points each: [10] Name this poet, who included that poem in his collection Satires of Circumstance. He also wrote "The Convergence of the Twain" and "The Darkling Thrush."
